intro: Couratari paraensis, commonly known as the Amazonian copaiba, is a species of flowering plant in the family Sapotaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly the Amazon rainforest. The plant is characterized by its smooth, aromatic bark and elliptical leaves with a glossy surface. It produces small, yellowish flowers that develop into woody capsules containing aromatic resin. The resin, known as copaiba balsam, has been traditionally used for its medicinal properties.
